column1: Mr. Cooper would rather insult the intelligence of SC’s voters than deal with this reality: in SC and across the country Democrat congressional candidates had a losing message. Clearly folks in SC were not buying what Mr. Harrison was selling. https://t.co/6CE5DiEnVF
https://t.co/yzfkxfZeF5

We are helping the Trump Campaign investigate fraudulent votes thoroughly. Whether it is ballots cast by the deceased incorrect online voter status or illicit ballot harvesting if you or someone you know has a firsthand account of suspicious voter activity submit it here:

It does not matter who the ballot was cast for every legal ballot should be counted in this election. This is a fundamental tenet of our republic.   But under no circumstances should illegal ballots be included in the results of this election.
@DanieljGross This tweet won't age well
Greenville and Spartanburg are ready to #GetItDone for Senator @LindseyGrahamSC! #SC04 https://t.co/6k8w2T0H7n

If you already voted absentee—either in person or by mail—we thank you!   And if you live in #SC04 it is truly an honor and privilege to represent you in Washington. I am grateful for the trust you have placed in me. I hope I can count on your support for a second term.
Today is the day. There is simply too much at stake in this election to not vote.   Be sure to bring a friend family member co-worker colleague or anyone else who is registered and wants to vote!
It was great to join Vice President @Mike_Pence at Donaldson Center in Greenville last week. The Upstate is fired up for Election Day on November 3!   📷: Dan Harvell https://t.co/aRz6VpT2jH

Last quarter the GDP grew by 33.1% the fastest rate in recorded history. In just three months we have recovered 2/3 of the GDP lost due to COVID-19. To compare under Obama and Joe Biden it took four quarters (an entire year) to recover from the 2008-2009 recession.
Welcome to South Carolina Vice President @Mike_Pence! We are excited to welcome you to the Upstate today. #SC04

Congratulations to Amy Coney Barrett on her confirmation to the U.S. Supreme Court! Thanks to Senator @LindseyGrahamSC and President @realDonaldTrump we have a highly-qualified Associate Justice who will interpret our laws as written and defend our Constitution.

It has been an honor to represent the Fourth Congressional District in Congress for the past two years. Our team has worked hard to get results for the Upstate and I am proud of what we have been able to accomplish.   https://t.co/p2xA5mu6kc
Take a friend or family member and make sure your voice is heard. Visit https://t.co/DN7pelMD3A to find the Upstate voting location closest to you. #SCGOP

On Election Day we are anticipating long lines so go vote early and avoid the lines if you can! If you choose to vote early it is safe secure and your vote will count the same as if you vote on Election Day. So go ahead and get it done.

Due to concerns about coronavirus South Carolina has a new law that makes it easier for people to vote early this year. In our area that means you can vote at a number of locations in Greenville and Spartanburg counties each weekday.
100% of funds raised will go directly to support Master Deputy Jumper’s family and to honor his service. https://t.co/qPYa0w5jlv
Our hearts go out to the family and loved ones of Master Deputy Conley Jumper with the Greenville County Sheriff’s Office. He was a member of law enforcement for 28 years with a passion for serving.
South Carolina has   @LindseyGrahamSC’s back while he is in Washington getting Judge Barrett confirmed.

This is an unfortunate example of the state of civil discourse in America. These people accosted Senator Graham in the airport and accused Judge Amy Coney Barrett of being a “racist” and “unqualified” because she will not be an activist judge that legislates from the bench. https://t.co/sdpPgItQX2

Thank you to all who joined us this morning in Simpsonville to support @LindseyGrahamSC. Senator Graham fights hard for South Carolina and our nation. Make a plan to vote early or absentee by visiting https://t.co/DN7pelMD3A. https://t.co/swLrWhYmAW
Bill Bledsoe has dropped out of the race and has endorsed @LindseyGrahamSC. South Carolinians see right through these dirty tricks.

Why are Jaime Harrison and the SC Democratic Party spending millions of dollars to promote the third party candidate for Senate Bill Bledsoe? Harrison is trying to split the conservative vote because he knows he is out of touch and his liberal policies cannot win here in S.C.

Make no mistake Harrison is no moderate and he would do whatever it takes to block originalists from being on the courts. He calls Pelosi his "mentor" and would be another pawn for Chuck Schumer and Pelosi’s radical agenda. We need to send @LindseyGrahamSC back to Washington.

If Jaime Harrison was sitting in Senator Graham's seat today Harrison would be attacking Judge Barrett on every issue such as guns life and religion in an attempt to block a highly qualified nominee from becoming a Supreme Court Justice.

“On top of their impressive voting records they worked with their colleagues to enact and retain historic tax cuts support deregulation and help ignite America’s economic boom. I urge their constituents to re-elect them to the House.”  https://t.co/hdzKcw3Bf2
“During their tenures in the House Reps. Duncan Norman Rice and Timmons have been strong and reliable votes to curb government waste and reform Washington” said CCAGW PAC Chairman Tom Schatz.

My job is to advocate for #SC04 and our Upstate values. I am proud to serve my country and hope that I have earned your support for another term. More on why I believe I am the best choice to continue representing us in Washington in The @GreenvilleNews.  https://t.co/I1mpwDf9BP

Absentee voting has begun in South Carolina! I would appreciate your vote as we continue the fight for our Upstate values and more accountability in Washington. Cast your absentee ballot securely between now and Nov. 2 at locations across the Fourth Congressional District. #SC04 https://t.co/cUc1Ua1Cdc
There is still time to register to vote for the upcoming election on November 3rd! Register online by mail or check your registration by visiting https://t.co/zcxFT31m6e.   https://t.co/IBxdgVXzfx
Wishing a very happy birthday to the one and only @votetimscott! South Carolina and the nation are grateful for your leadership. https://t.co/6nxD2GWeCw
Whereas universal vote by mail is ripe for fraud expanded absentee voting will help ensure the integrity of the upcoming election and the safety of registered voters in November.

Yesterday Governor @henrymcmaster signed a bipartisan bill into law expanding absentee voting in South Carolina for the upcoming election. Any SC voter under an emergency declaration may now request an absentee ballot regardless of age disability status or work conflict.

Alternatively:  Competence over diminished cognitive function.  Rule of law over riots violence and looting.   American exceptionalism over a continuation of Obama's apology tour.   @realDonaldTrump over @JoeBiden. https://t.co/35Ie9ajaps

This Labor Day we want to recognize our frontline and essential workers who have kept our country going during the pandemic. The American workforce has faced extraordinary challenges this year but there is no challenge that we cannot overcome. Happy Labor Day! 🇺🇸

I just signed the Police Pledge to stand with our police and pledge to oppose any bill resolution or movement to “Defund the Police.” A lawful society—free from mob rule and violent insurrection—is not possible without Law Enforcement. Now more than ever they need our support.
Wow. Phenomenal speeches and stories from @votetimscott and @NikkiHaley. Hope and unity will always triumph over division. South Carolina is incredibly proud tonight!

Members of #TeamTimmons were on the ground today at @GSPAirport as @POTUS headed back to Washington on Air Force One. We were honored to have President Trump in the Upstate. We hope to welcome you back soon! https://t.co/Q8Is0ykW8E

At 8:30pm the first night of the @GOPconvention begins. I am looking forward to hearing from South Carolina’s own @SenatorTimScott and @NikkiHaley as we celebrate America the Land of Promise! #RNC2020

Any qualified person or couple in South Carolina can still become a foster parent regardless of their race religion ethnicity or sexual orientation and there are other private and state agencies across the state that need more foster parents.

Mrs. Nelson you are absolutely right I do not engage in theatrics. What I do is stand up for foster care providers like Miracle Hill who want to provide homes for needy children and maintain their religious convictions at the same time. This waiver is specific to Miracle Hill. https://t.co/IHt6NANZf5
My commitment to fiscal responsibility is more than just words. Addressing our debt and spending problem in Washington will always be one of my top priorities. @BudgetHawks

I am proud to be named a “Fiscal Hero” by the Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget/Fix the Debt. Our national debt and deficit are skyrocketing with little concern for the burden on future generations.
A pragmatic moderate? She supports Medicare for All the Green New Deal late-term abortions and sanctuary cities—just to name a few. Nothing moderate about that. https://t.co/7OtreOOvGD

Senator @LindseyGrahamSC is exactly right. If football games are happening so should the Clemson-South Carolina game. It's a South Carolina tradition and it should continue this year. https://t.co/xW99HPLGNE

Today America needs heroes — now more than ever.  South Carolina's own Bobby Richardson has been a role model both on and off the baseball field. Let's honor him with the nation’s highest civilian award the Presidential Medal of Freedom.  https://t.co/5RTqsjon0Q

...over their health care than traditional Medicare plans. I will continue to fight against a complete government takeover of our health care system from the Left like Medicare for All which would eliminate these plans and replace them with a one size fits all plan.

I am proud to receive the Medicare Advantage Congressional Supporter Award from Better Medicare Alliance. Medicare Advantage plans are hugely popular among South Carolina seniors with over 50000 enrollees in #SC04. These plans give seniors more control...

I just finished @DanCrenshawTX’s audio book “Fortitude: American Resilience in the Era of Outrage.” I strongly recommend it. It is worth a read or listen. During these trying times we can all use a little more fortitude. https://t.co/5bayco16qg

Happy Fourth of July South Carolina! We are the land of the free because of the brave. Thank you to all who have served past and present for our freedom. While our celebrations may be different this year I hope you and your family have a safe Independence Day. https://t.co/tclKrBCNUQ
ICYMI: We had another great jobs report for June.   ✅ 4.8 million jobs added ✅ Unemployment fell to 11.1% ✅ Largest single-month gain in U.S. history

Election Alert: If you live in Greenville or Spartanburg counties there are runoff primaries today that will decide who serves you in local office. You can vote from now until 7pm! Find more information and your polling place here: https://t.co/BELGtNEwvz
Happy Father’s Day to all the wonderful dads here in South Carolina! I hope you enjoy your day with family and loved ones.

I hope you will join me this Friday June 19 at 7:00 pm to watch a special virtual production of "One Voice: Black and Blue" followed by a live Q&A with @itsJDew and Greenville County Sheriff Hobart Lewis. Register for free today by visiting https://t.co/xXwADvVcZ3. https://t.co/lzzy6IGYaM
Today is the day South Carolina! Polls are open across the state until 7:00 pm. Make your voice heard and go vote! Find your polling location here: https://t.co/r5ma32jsTq

Some encouraging news today from May’s jobs report:  ✅ 2.5 million jobs added ✅ Unemployment rate dropped to 13.3% well below expectations  There is still more work to be done but we are another step forward on the road to economic recovery.

We are ONE WEEK away from the South Carolina primary election. Sarah and I encourage everyone in Senate District 12 to re-elect Senator @scottftalley. Make sure you vote on June 9th! https://t.co/q41JcixnYn
Happy birthday Governor @henrymcmaster! https://t.co/RBuGyVjzzw
Remember them this Memorial Day. https://t.co/kegc3zS3Eu
Happy Birthday South Carolina! On this day in 1788 South Carolina became the eighth state to ratify the U.S. Constitution. I am so proud to call the Palmetto State home. https://t.co/20pZH1F7kd

This op-ed from @Shay_Hawkins_OH is worth your time. What Joe Biden said earlier today was racist and wrong. I agree with Shay— his half-hearted apology was just as dismissive as his initial comments. https://t.co/zjJ4msp59B

Planned Parenthood affiliates must return any money they received immediately. Planned Parenthood is not a small business and must be held accountable if they knowingly broke the law.  https://t.co/wDF1Laai8g

We are 100 days out from the @GOPconvention! In August we will be in Charlotte to re-nominate President @realDonaldTrump for another four years. This event will play an integral role in promoting local businesses and generating millions of dollars across the Carolinas. #RNCinCLT
Congratulations to @MikeGarcia2020 on your hard-fought victory in CA-25! https://t.co/SVwXIK0m6x
Congratulations to @TomTiffanyWI for your victory last night in WI-07. We look forward to having you in Congress!
Today we celebrate our mothers for their unconditional love support and encouragement. Wishing a very happy Mother's Day to my mom and all the wonderful moms in South Carolina!

Neil Ferrier of Discommon in Greenville used his business expertise to help @ghs_org secure 1.5 million masks for health care workers. Read more in @gvljournal: https://t.co/T2AEFkMagU

He is risen indeed! Today we remember Jesus' sacrifice and give thanks for God's love and glory. Through Him we can overcome even our darkest of days.   The Lord is on my side; I will not fear. Psalm 118:6 https://t.co/OHBpCWIdvp

As we stay inside to combat #COVID19 we cannot forget about those who are experiencing homelessness. State Senator Talley @SenRossTurner and I teamed up to provide 300 meals to @MiracleHill. A huge thank you to Stax’s Original in Greenville for helping to make this happen.

Thank you to Senator @LindseyGrahamSC and @SenatorTimScott for working hard to help South Carolina’s small businesses workers doctors and nurses. We have no time to waste to deliver help for the American people. Thank you Senators and your staffs!   https://t.co/8pDJrXWlcL

This "process" has not been fair from the beginning and the Senate Republicans are right to dismiss it. (4/4)
Six of the House's seven impeachment managers called for impeachment BEFORE THERE WAS EVEN A WHISTLEBLOWER COMPLAINT! (3/4)
It was only a couple weeks ago when Adam Schiff himself was leading secret hearings in the basement of the Capitol. (2/4)
With impeachment proceedings beginning in the Senate I am struck by the irony of Democrats' requests for "fairness" and "transparency." (1/4)
